clauses: if it is commited by breaking or entering
Preceded, accompanied or followed by acts of violence
Preceded, accompanied or followed by acts of violence causing mutilation or permanent disability
Preceded, accompanied or followed by torture or acts of cruelty
Preceded, accompanied or followed by violence unintentionally causing the death of the victim.

additional penalties: Forfeiture of certain rights, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Prohibition from practising a profession in the practice of or in connection with which the offence was committed, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Prohibition from driving any motor vehicle permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Local exclusion for a period not exceeding ten years for a felony or not exceeding five years for a misdemeanour
Prohibition from entering and residing in the territory of the Kingdom of Cambodia for a convicted foreigner, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Confiscation of any instruments, materials or items which were used or intended to be used to commit the offence
Confiscation of the items or funds which were the subject of the offence
Confiscation of the proceeds or property arising out of the offence
Confiscation of the utensils, materials and furnishings in the premises in which the offence was committed
Confiscation of one or more vehicles belonging to the convicted person
Prohibition from possessing or carrying any weapon, explosive or ammunition of any kind
Closure of an establishment used to plan or to commit the offence, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Prohibition from operating an establishment that is open to or used by the public, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Publication of sentencing decision for a period not exceeding two months
Publication of sentencing decision in the print media
Broadcasting of sentencing decision by any audio-visual communication for a period not exceeding eight days

clauses: Wilful killing of another person with or without a weapon with no aggravating circumstances
Murder committed with premeditation or by ambush
against a person who is particularly vulnerable by reason of his or her age
against a pregnant woman whose pregnancy is obvious or known to the perpetrator
against a person who is particularly vulnerable by reason of his or her illness or disability which is obvious or known to the perpetrator
against a public official in the performance of his or her duties or in connection therewith
against a victim or a civil party, either to prevent him or her from reporting an offence or seeking reparation for harm
against a witness to prevent him or her from testifying at an investigation, a judicial investigation, a trial or in the proceedings of other complaints
against a victim or a civil party for reporting an offence or seeking reparation for harm suffered
against a witness for testifying at an investigation, a judicial investigation, a trial or in the proceedings of other complaints
committed by a public official in the performance of his or her duties or in connection therewith
Murder preceded or followed by torture, cruelty or rape

additional penalties: Forfeiture of certain rights, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Prohibition from practising a profession in the practice of or in connection with which the offence was committed, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Prohibition from driving any motor vehicle permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Local exclusion for a period not exceeding ten years for a felony or not exceeding five years for a misdemeanour
Prohibition from entering and residing in the territory of the Kingdom of Cambodia for a convicted foreigner, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Confiscation of any instruments, materials or items which were used or intended to be used to commit the offence
Confiscation of the items or funds which were the subject of the offence
Confiscation of the proceeds or property arising out of the offence
Confiscation of the utensils, materials and furnishings in the premises in which the offence was committed
Confiscation of one or more vehicles belonging to the convicted person
Prohibition from possessing or carrying any weapon, explosive or ammunition of any kind
Closure of an establishment used to plan or to commit the offence, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Prohibition from operating an establishment that is open to or used by the public, either permanently or for a period not exceeding five years
Publication of sentencing decision for a period not exceeding two months
Publication of sentencing decision in the print media
Broadcasting of sentencing decision by any audio-visual communication for a period not exceeding eight days
